column4: question: im on Ubuntu 12.04. I just check for updates and noticed that some of my updates arent checked. does this mean they arent needed?
open a term window and type: sudo apt-get dist-upgrade                  Is anything held back?
what do you mean held back?
it says there are packages held back, they are all the same packages.
that doesnt show what command you used
thats rare when that happens. you might want to read this:   http://askubuntu.com/questions/216371/apt-get-dist-upgrade-doesnt-fix-the-following-packages-have-been-kept-back
could these packages have been disabled when i installed Ubuntu-restricted extras and it had to remove libav* stuff
did you use a different repo, and then truned off that repo?
this is a work computer so i didnt do too much extra to it
what happens if you type:  sudp apt-get autoremove    ?
sorry, I havent done you much good. Not sure why thats happening. Keep asking in here, or try the mailing list
